title: Google won’t honor medical leave during its layoffs, outraging employees
description: Ex-Googler says she was laid off from her hospital bed shortly after giving birth.

title: Anthropic introduces Claude, a “more steerable” AI competitor to ChatGPT
description: Anthropic aims for "safer" and "less harmful" AI, but at a higher price.

title: Bent nails at Roman burial site form “magical barrier” to keep dead from rising
description: Cremated remains were also covered in brick tiles and a thick layer of lime.

title: Google tells users of some Android phones: Nuke voice calling to avoid infection
description: If your device runs Exynos chips, be very, very concerned.

title: Microsoft is testing a built-in cryptocurrency wallet for the Edge browser
description: Crypto wallet would join coupons, cash back, and "buy now, pay later" add-ons.

title: Travel well with today’s best deals: iPad Air, iPad Mini, and Bose’s QuietComfort 45
description: A capable tablet and a comfy pair of headphones can make any trip a lot easier.

title: US investigates TikTok owner ByteDance’s surveillance of journalists
description: ByteDance said it condemned actions of its former employees.

title: Nuclear Waste Borehole Demonstration Center started
description: Collaborators are lined up, but the center is homeless at the moment.

title: YouTube TV jumps in price again—it’s now $72.99 per month
description: The base package is going up $8, but the 4K add-on is going down $10.

title: Genetic data links SARS-CoV-2 to raccoon dogs in China market, scientists say
description: "These data could have—and should have—been shared three years ago."

title: Starlink/T-Mobile plan for satellite-to-phone service to get boost from FCC
description: Low-Earth orbit satellites to serve phones in remote areas without cell coverage.

title: Inside Elon Musk’s cost-cutting drive at Twitter
description: His lieutenants have upended the company by IDing who to fire, refusing to pay vendors.

title: PLATO: How an educational computer system from the ’60s shaped the future
description: Forums, instant messaging, and multiplayer video games all started here.

title: We finally have proof of active volcanoes on Venus
description: Researchers pored over images from Magellan's visit to Venus in the early 1990s.
